700889f-a.text:
E. Gunhill Road ("El" thereon), west from White Plains Road. The elevated structure is that of the Interborough Rapid Transit Co. and is a shuttle line connecting the White Plains Road subway with the Third Avenue elevated lines at Webster Avenue and E. 210th Street. The elevated trestle, after crossing the Bronx River, can be seen making a southward bend on Webster Avenue.
June 1, 1928
P. L. Sperr
700889f-a.folder: Gun Hill Road (East) & White Plains Road, Bronx, NY
700889f-a.original_title: Bronx: Gun Hill Road (East) - White Plains Road

702151f-a.text:
White Plains Road, adjoining to the south East Gunhill Road, showing a public comfort station under construction by the W.P.A. The building stands in a little public square which divides the thoroughfare in two separate lanes.
December 14, 1936.
Works Progress Administration.
Federal Art Project photo.
702151f-a.folder: White Plains Road & Gunhill Road (East), Bronx, NY
702151f-a.original_title: Bronx: White Plains Road - Gunhill Road (East)

700888f-b.text:
(1)
E. Gunhill Road, east from White Plains Road. On the S.E. corner of Holland Avenue appears the Roman Catholic Church of the Immaculate Conception, and beyond that, Evander Childs High School.
May 11, 1938.
P. L. Sperr.
(2) The same, another view.
May 11, 1938.
P. L. Sperr.
(3) An additional view from a slightly different angle.
May 11, 1938.
P. L. Sperr.

702150f-a.text:
White Plains Road (right, elevated thereon), east side, south from E. Gunhill Road. Also shown is a panoramic view in a southeasterly direction as seen from the Williamsbridge station of the I.R.T. subway.
May 11, 1938.
P. L. Sperr.
